question_stem.en:
A 58-year-old man undergoes operative repair of a descending thoracic aortic aneurysm. There are no intraoperative complications, but postoperatively the patient is found to have new-onset neurologic deficits. Imaging of the brain is normal, but MRI of the lower thoracic spinal cord reveals ischemic infarct of the areas shown in the exhibit below: {{exhibit_1}}

Lower extremity examination of this patient is most likely to show which of the following neurologic findings?
question_stem.zh:
一名58岁男性接受降主动脉胸主动脉瘤的手术修复。术中无并发症，但术后发现患者出现新发神经功能缺损。脑部影像学检查正常，但胸椎下段脊髓的MRI显示以下所示区域发生缺血性梗死：{{exhibit_1}}

该患者的下肢检查最有可能显示以下哪种神经系统发现？

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of anterior cord syndrome, its pathophysiology, and the resulting sensory and motor deficits. It requires correlating the location of the spinal cord infarct with the specific tracts affected and their corresponding neurological functions.

To solve this question, identify the affected area of the spinal cord from the provided MRI. Recall the vascular supply of the spinal cord and the clinical presentation of anterior cord syndrome. Then, determine which sensory modalities and motor functions are preserved or lost based on the tracts affected by the infarct, and match this with the provided options.
summary.zh:
此题考察对前脊髓综合征、其病理生理学以及由此产生的感觉和运动功能的理解。需要将脊髓梗死的位置与受影响的特定束及其相应的神经功能相关联。

要解决此问题，请从提供的MRI中识别脊髓的受影响区域。回想脊髓的血管供应以及前脊髓综合征的临床表现。然后，根据梗死影响的束确定哪些感觉模式和运动功能被保留或丧失，并将其与提供的选项相匹配。
